column1: #Text=Over 900 asylum seekers rescued off Indonesian coast
#Text=On Friday , fishermen rescued over 700 asylum seekers whose boat sank , and the Indonesian Navy reportedly saved 200 more after they were found swimming along the coast of Aceh , Indonesia .
#Text=Major general Fuad Basya , spokesman for the Indonesian military , said fisherman first noticed the people and a warship was deployed to retrieve them .
#Text=The rescued members included Bangladeshis and Rohingya , a stateless minority of Muslims from Myanmar .
#Text=Myanmar is mainly Buddhist and the United Nations rates the Rohingya among the world 's most persecuted groups .
#Text=According to ABC News , Basya also believes the asylum seekers found in the water may have left the boat on purpose to be rescued to avoid being sent away from Indonesia waters .
#Text=Malaysia and Indonesia have maintained a policy of turning away boats of migrants which , according to AFP , the Untied Nations and United States have both criticised .
#Text=One Rohingya , Muhammad Amin , the first boat rescued on Friday was turned around twice , toward Malaysia by Indonesian navy and then toward Indonesia by Malaysian navy .

#Text=Discussing his concern in a public statement , Malaysia 's Prime Minister , Najib Razak said , " A team of six Afghan teenage girls , who were initially denied an entry visa to the US twice , was awarded a silver medal for ' courageous achievement ' in the FIRST Global Challenge Robot Olympics in Washington , DC , - after an intervention from US President Donald Trump allowed them to enter the country .

#Text=Jeff Rathke , the State Department Spokesperson , said ,  We urge the governments of the region to work together quickly , first and foremost , to save the lives of migrants now at sea who are in need of an immediate rescue effort " .

column1: #Text=Rathke also asked the governments of South East Asia not to turn away boats of people seeking asylum .
#Text=Estimates suggest 8000 migrants may be currently at sea in the region .
